items.title: The Caledonian torture
items.review_text:
My girlfriend and I have recently returned from a trip to Scotland and had a great time in Edinburgh and a tour around the highlands.

I looked at various ways of getting to Edinburgh from London and choose the Caledonian Sleeper train, the berths seemed overpriced, so, decided to get the chairs thinking the chairs must be reasonably comfortable for an eight-hour overnight trip.

But how wrong was I, I’ll start by stating the positives, the carriages are clean and tidy and the trains run on time, they give you a night pack consisting of an eye mask and ear plugs and there is a reading light and charger socket for your phone.

Now the negatives, they have made no attempt to make the chairs comfortable, they are as hard as stone. The chairs move forward a little but the backrest stays upright with no recline facility, if you try to rest your back on the window with your legs across the floor the arm rest (that doesn’t flip-up) sticks in your back.

When they dim the lights there are led spot lights on the ceiling that stay on that shine directly In your face.

During the night it gets cold, there is an air vent below the window that pushes out cold air all night long. I would recommend taking a warm blanket.

It’s also noisy, however, to be fair I expected that, but what I didn’t expect was a uncomfortable freezing night on up-right hard chairs with little hope of getting any sleep at all.

I will not be using Caledonian Sleeper again as I have no wish to go through that 8 hour torture ever again.

items.title: Poor experience on so many levels
items.review_text: On the way out everything was served in cheap plastic including plastic cups for wine. Not club class by any means. The cabins are much much smaller than the photos show . The train is very noisy so don't expect to sleep well. The food is mediocre and cheap. The worst thing of all was we had no water from 6am so couldn't shower or clean our teeth and even worse was we couldn't flush the loo after doing a number 2. Utterly embarrassing.  The staff were friendly and the return journey was marginally better. This had been on my wish list for 50 years and a major disappointment.

items.title: Good luck getting a refund.
items.review_text: Good luck getting a refund, nothing short of criminal.

items.title: Won’t do it again
items.review_text:
We paid £1700 as a party of 8 for our twin/double cabins (one way!), which was to include the lounge at both ends. On the day of travel, we’d already travelled 5 hours to get to Glasgow and received a text while in Glasgow to let us know the lounge wouldn’t be available at the Glasgow side. I emailed the company on our return to let them know it was a disappointment and inconvenient that we were unable to use the lounge at Glasgow  to be told that they had let us know this was unavailable in ample time, there was left luggage facilities we could have used at Central Station and we could have eaten at Central Station too - all at our own expense of course! Poor customer service and attitude. 
It’s also not clear on arrival at Euston where the lounge is, there was no signs when we got off the train to point us in the right direction. We were all so tired at this stage that we went to our hotel and paid to get into one of the rooms early to get ready for the day.

Onboard, we couldn’t fault the staff, they were attentive and very helpful. The cabin itself was tiny and very loud and uncomfortable during the night. We’ve now done it once but wouldn’t do this again, especially given the aftercare attitude.

items.title: Great first journey
items.review_text:
This was my first time using the Caledonian Sleeper and was really impressed. 
Staff were all great, bed was comfortable, and the shower was much better than I had been expecting.
Saved us having to get a hotel and was able to sleep through the usual long journey from Glasgow to London. The breakfast was excellent too.

items.title: Great railway journey
items.review_text:
Came back on Inverness - Euston service 4th October  Club Solo ( K1 ) with my railcard cost £120 
Warm welcome from crew, nice breakfast, VERY comfy bed.  Slept from 10pm to 5.45, just before breakfast came. Ensuite shower and toilet.. really couldn't fault it and will definitely travel again. Very professional hostess in Lounge opposite station. 
One suggestion, remove the ladder when single occupancy
Well designed and a lot in a small space..

items.title: Falls massively below expectations
items.review_text:
I think that perhaps the flashy marketing doesn't quite match the experience, which makes it even worse.

Where to start? The seats were really uncomfortable, the seated coach was freezing all night, I didn't see a member of staff the entire time, there was a menu provided with no means of ordering anything, and I couldn't find anyone when I disembarked to ask about shower tokens - I had to walk up to Kings X and pay to shower there. 

Never again - I'll get the early LNER next time!

items.title: Took sleeper to Aberdeen and back for…
items.review_text:
Took sleeper to Aberdeen and back for my child’s graduation, a ‘refreshing’ trip in their ‘comfortable’ sleeper seat.  OMG - they couldn’t have designed a less comfortable seat if they’d tried.  Rock hard, reclines about an inch, bum became numb after an hour so spent rest of the journey jiggling about to relieve pressure.  Foot room and knee room minimal.  I’ve just sent the company my observations and health and safety regulations are apparently, the reason why the seats are made the way they are.   Hmmmm….
My advice - believe the reviews.  About comfort, cold cabins, bright lights, people sleeping on floors, the lot.  And then find another way to get to your destination.

items.title: Excessive Journey Time & Too Many Long Stops
items.review_text: Used service from Stonehaven after a friends funeral in Forfar. Sleeper seat comfortable enough and service fairly attentive. What’s killed it for me is the journey rime (12.5 hours) and the excessive stop times including 2 hours in Edinburgh. Thought we were going to arrive 1.5 hours early but instead, took a right turn at Camden and now stopped in a railway parking lot in sight of Wembley stadium. Still 50 min to run. Totally bizarre. The price was right, but probably stick to day time trains in future.

items.title: Best sleeper experiance
items.review_text: Had a fantastic experience in a double room on the caledonian sleeper. Travelled from London to Aberdeen. The price for the double room is a lot higher but so worth it for myself and partner. Private room. Heating/air con worked perfectly. Able to turn lights out and breakfast delivered to our door in the morning

items.title: The most civilised way to Travel from London to Scotland? Please...
items.review_text:
I am currently riding the train and not sleeping, as it appears to be an ordeal to do do. The light is slightly dimmed but still particularly bright, cold air is blasting from the side of the seat making it freezing (part of the car has heat but it seems to be limited to 3 rows) and the earplugs are apparently of the useless kind. 
I am used to sleeper trains and to night buses: an overnight journey across France on a crowded bus the day before Christmas during the SNCF strikes provided me with more sleep than this...
Thanks nonetheless to the staff who was polite and nice. The plugs are also a plus. 
In any case, given the choice, go for an LNER train.

items.title: No sleep on the sleeper + severe delays
items.review_text:
I'll start with saying that the staff are absolutely lovely. But that's the last positive thing I'm going to say in this review. 

I'm taking the night train from Aberdeen to Euston, Lights were on for a long time and the seats are not amazing, so sleep was difficult.

This was supposed to be a direct ride to London. However, only upon embarking the train was I informed that the night's sleep will be interrupted gently at 1am and everyone will have to move to another train, and be able to go back to sleep immediately.

We arrive at Edinburgh for the change. Wait for a long time on the train, then we are asked to leave the train but have to wait in the cold for almost 20 minutes. So any chance of going back to sleep is gone. But that's not all. We then stay put for two hours before anyone bothers to tell us that we're going to stay there at least until 4am and arrive at least 2.5 hours late to our destinatiln. We still haven't left so the nightmare is not over yet. Pray for us.

items.title: Seriously don't know how they expect…
items.review_text:
Seriously don't know how they expect someone to sleep in a chair that reclines less than an inch. Advertised as luxury reclining chair, in fact the same as the abellio service chairs, comfort wise. Unless you shell out for a private cabin (cheaper to fly-and quicker), you'll be in a fully lit compartment which can not be dimmed 'for safety reasons'.

100% the worst way to travel from Scotland to London if you actually have plans other than catching up on sleep once you arrive. Would highly encourage someone to seek other options of transport.

items.title: Upset & fuming
items.review_text: We booked the sleeper train to Inverness for my 70 th birthday next week, just had text to say cancelled due to strike. Completely ruined my birthday plans, had booked hotel in Inverness for 2 night which we’ve had to cancel. A connecting train from Blackpool to London booked but as advanced ticket no entitled to refund. Absolutely fuming & disgusted. Then get email from them to say hope you’ll book again in the future, Absolutely no chance 70th ruined & out of pocket.😡

items.title: Very sub-par experience
items.review_text: Very average, the seating cabin is dirty, uncomfortable and the light is bright and harsh all through the night. Non fresh air is cycled through the cabin, and during stops the cabin feels like an incubator of hot air and germs. After all the marketing about how luxurious it was on their website, it was a completely opposite experience. Never again.

items.title: Incredibly overpriced
items.review_text: Incredibly overpriced for what it is. The refurbishment of this was meant to be supported by government funding. Why is the service we've been left with something where you have to pay a FORTUNE for a ticket? The advertising is of luxury, but the reality is quite different. I don't want luxury, and I don't want to pay a fortune. All I want is an affordable, reliable and comfortable sleeper service for Scotland. The wasted opportunity here makes me so sad.

items.title: Ideal for a special occasion or short break
items.review_text: Had an outstanding return trip from London to Inverness. The train was on time, accommodation comfortable and well equipped with everything that was needed. The staff were friendly and attentive and the club coach menu was very good. It wasn't cheap but for a special occasion, it is highly recommended.

items.title: GYMNASTICS
items.review_text: The mattresses offer no resistance whatsoever between your body and the hard-board.  Just like sleeping on the floor.  If you have a weak bladder and need frequent visits to the toilet then grab the bottom bunk bed.  The top bunk requires a gymnast to manouver the body into a safe position to descend the ladder.  No head room whatsoever, so this manouvering has to be achieved while laying down. I suspect a coffin would give you more room. The ladder steps, incidentally, are so thin, that shoes are required, so you'll have to  sleep with a pair on your bed.   The bacon roll breakfast was cold, without butter, tastless and stale.   The companies description of this sleeper breaches The Trade Description Act.

items.title: Shambles.
items.review_text:
Rock hard seats that are almost definitely designed to be uncomfortable so you pay for their overpriced smaller than a prison cell rooms. Apparently the seats recline? They go slightly back, not that you can tell. 
Constantly randomly stopping for no good reason, (unless there is but good luck getting told anything!). 
£2.70 for a cup of tea/coffee. The coffee being a Nescafé sachet…. Although, does come with a tasty shortbread. 
If you’re wanting to travel and want to be on time and feeling refreshed, the Caledonian Sleeper is not for you.

items.title: I had not one but two horrible journeys…
items.review_text: I had not one but two horrible journeys on the Caledonian sleeper. I would never recommend you waste your money on this train. The aircon didn’t work in the 4m sq cabin which was disgustingly uncomfortable. To add insult to injury 4 days later we had the return journey back to London. Coincidentally we were in the same carriage and remarkably the aircon had not been repaired over the 4 days !! These carriages were not fit for purpose, nor were we told in advance so had to endure the same horrible conditions for 13 hours. This company is a disgrace. The management on the train were out of there depth blaming everyone else and the follow up has been appalling.

items.title: Just not up to standard for the price.
items.review_text: Had a double room with en-suite as a treat. The shower initially only provided cold water, then none at all. The breakfast we ordered in the evening was not available in the morning. So we arrived feeling hungry and grubby. This is really not acceptable when paying £400+ for a room. We learned afterwards that showers were available at the station but were not even made aware of this by staff. All in all a terrible experience, and would not recommend.

items.title: Freezing noisy air con blasting all…
items.review_text: Freezing noisy air con blasting all night in the seated carriage. Lights on all night, even though personal reading lights are available, as advertised. Late both ways with zero information. Some seats dont recline, must be broken all ready? Advice: dont do it. If you're on a budget get the bus. Dreadful experience

items.title: Arriving to my sit at the Caledonian…
items.review_text:
Arriving to my sit at the Caledonian sleeper, after delayed trains, my journey was Copenhagen - Edinbourgh, on my sit there was a menu for the dinning car. I love train restaurants!
BUT I WAS NOT ALLOWED IN THE RESTAURANT BECAUSE I WAS IN SITTING WAGON!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I tried again in the morning, but no! an empty restaurant where I couldn't sit!!!
Taking long delayed train rides can be stressful, because something you can't get food!!!!!

items.title: Avoid….
items.review_text:
Due to illness I needed to cancel a journey to London( Avanti) and back( Sleeper). No hassle with Avanti and a nominal charge to change. 
Totally inflexible response from Caledonian, including a lecture on ‘T’s and C’s’ which apparently insist that changes can only be made prior to 12.00 on the day preceding planned travel. 

Subsequently wrote( because you can’t email) to the MD, and have not even had the courtesy of an acknowledgement.

If you are considering this, expensive option, you may wish to be aware of their inflexibility towards their customers, and ex-customers.

Easily the worst rail company to deal with!

items.title: Civilised, relaxing and better than flying.
items.review_text: First time using this service and I was very impressed. The fact that you can board and alight for up to 1h before / after avoids any rushes, there isn’t any of the hassle of airport security or queues. The train is quiet (electric, I think). Our classic cabin was functional and perfectly adequate; and certainly more comfortable than economy class flying. The staff were friendly and greeted you on arrival. It all felt civilised, relaxing and more environmentally friendly than flying. The complimentary bag of ear plugs and eye mask was nice but felt a bit wasteful. All in all, better than flying.

items.title: Great experience on the sleeper train
items.review_text:
Great experience on the sleeper train. 
Travelled from London to Inverness return, Classic on way up and Club on way down. In future, I would be fine with just the Classic as I didn't mind using the shared bathroom. 
We had a slight delay on the outbound journey but the time difference was made up by the time we arrived.
We are parents with a 1.5yr old child. Travel cot *just* fit into the floor space so child could sleep there. We stored additional luggage in the seated compartment and only took what we needed to the cabin as there isn't much storage. 
Very efficient and stress free versus driving or flying.

items.title: Excelente servicio al cliente
items.review_text: Excelente servicio al cliente, previa je me asistieron con mi pase como no lo hizo la empresa Eurail. El día del viaje nos mantuvieron informados todo el tiempo de una demora por problemas ajenos y el viaje en cómodo asiento, el camarote sobrepasaba nuestro presupuesto de argentinos, fue placentero y descansado. Edinburgo Londres fue un viaje de placer

items.title: Me and my 3 mates from London boarded…
items.review_text:
Me and my 3 mates from London boarded the Sleeper to Fort William from Euston. Loved it! The rooms were small, as expected. But very clean and comfortable. Leon looked after us so well in the restaurant car, nothing was too much trouble - a big thank you to Leon! 

Gillian took care of us on the way home a few days later - could not have been more welcoming and accommodating. Thanks for making our return leg a breeze Gillian.

We slept well in the cabins - quite remarkable for 4 decent sized 50 something lads. 

Can't recommend this service enough!

Thank you

items.title: Avoid the seated option at all costs
items.review_text:
Avoid the seated option at all costs. 

My goodness me it was horrible. So loud, no reclining, not even a bottle of water. Pretty impossible to get any sleep at all. 

The seated carriage is right behind the engine, and no soundproofing in there so its pretty loud for the entire journey. 

Sure the seats have a charging point, and mask/ear buds but no bottle of water. 

Arrival at Euston consisted of a man walking through the carriage 30 mins early shouting "EUSTON!". 

What I was so surprised by was the lack of warm service - no warm welcome on board, no warm announcement that we're arriving into euston etc - really lacking. 

Honestly for the price point: use a coach, more room, cheaper, and quieter.

items.title: Uncomfortable seats and very cold, brightly lit carriage.
items.review_text:
I've used the sleeper from euston to Edinburgh twice in the past few months. The first time with my partner in a twin room, which although it's a bit noisy to get a great night's sleep was at least was well designed and cosy and then staff were very welcoming, with a morning coffee and porridge bar included.

Last night I had a seat - the "single" penalty of travelling alone, as paid same per person as when we were two in a cabin. The seats are very uncomfortable, the carriage is very cold overnight (14 degrees) with no blankets available and fully lit. I didn't sleep at all, no staff were seen after ticket check at boarding, and no coffee. Very disappointing.

items.title: So sad to write this
items.review_text:
So sad to write this.  

Full of anticipation about the new en suite.

Clearly there cannot be anyone getting even tepid water in their shower.  Staff know of the issue and it’s like a giant guilty secret.  Shocking that management are prepared to entice us all and disappoint us all.   Freezing water reminded me of the 1970s but I won’t use again until they resolve the shower and it is indicative of the esteem management hold their customers if they don’t make sure they fix this chronic and extreme miss-sell

items.title: Great way to travel
items.review_text:
Normally I would fly to my office and apartment in Paris but I'm a total convert for Inverness > London and back now since co-vid.  Very impressed, superb service!  I posted 5 stars -I never give this for anything!!!!

Note though:  VERY noisy and shakes awful.  Not a problem Inverness>London but London>Inverness is a dodgem ride which gets worse the further north you get.  People joining / leaving in Edinburgh in the middle of the night are not quiet or respectful of others also.  That said -better than queuing and being packed in like sardines with proletarians flying any day!!!  It also doesn't take that much longer to go by train to Paris than flying in terms of lost business hours.

items.title: Good
items.review_text: Dont be put off by the negative reviews! We have been twice, both the old carriages and new en-suite. We had tremendous fun on both occasions.  As long as you understand you are on a blooming train and not a 5 star luxury resort hotel !! Yeap - the rooms are small but  comfortable, the sleep can be disjointed - yet cosy. The new carriages are better thanr the old ones which were  weathered around the edges, though always clean as they are now. The staff have been amazing, friendly and accommodating on both journeys. You cant beat the feeling once you've checked in - dumped your luggage in your own private space - pulled the cork on a nice bottle of red. Waking up in the Highlands is something else - the track is a single carriageway as the mountains, mist and heather roll by your window,

items.title: Club cabin = great experience
items.review_text: Me and my boyfriend booked club cabin to go to Edinburgh and back in July this year and had a really good experience. Great beds, it was nice to have shower with all the free toiletries given. It's a shame that due to coronavirus lockdowns the restaurant / bar was closed but I think the team have done their best to accomodate with decent breakfast in the morning. It's true there's not much space for luggage so don't take 23kg suitcase if possible but good enough for small luggage. After all, it's a sleeper train. Overall, good experience.

items.title: we were due to travel on the 19th july…
items.review_text: we were due to travel on the 19th july to inverness but the train was cancelled due to high temperatures and problems on the track so they used the train for a hotel for the night. we sat in the buffet car for a few hours before going cabin K6. and the staff were really good but a lady called VIERKA WAS EXCEPTIONAL and a credit to the company. Mr and Mrs Pym.

items.title: Expect delays
items.review_text: Expect delays, poor sleep, no information about what is happening and a great time feeling hungover from the lack of shut-eye. A few fitting names: Caledon't sleep, Calecan't be on time, and so on and so forth. Not worth the money, not worth the time. Sorry to be a let-down here, but almost everyone I spoke to on this train thinks that the service is performing poorly. Things to go forward on: live travel time updates on the screen, communication from the driver or someone who knows what is happening, reclining seats maybe? EAr plugs don't work, so bring your own, as there will be some cuckoo lady jamming to whatever during the night...

items.title: Really disappointed
items.review_text: Really disappointed, last time we travelled with Caledonian we had a small room which was ok. This time we had the seated carriage, prior to boarding we received a txt from Caledonian to say there would be no hot food or drinks due to faulty water system in galley, the seats are so uncomfortable no way can you sleep in them, they hardly recline. It was freezing cold 10 degrees, even with lights dimmed it was still too bright and at 1.50am in the morning lights were full on and air con on, just a joke. Not one member of staff came through to check if you needed anything. Pretty poor service.

items.title: Booked the double bed at great expense. No sound insulation from rails meant no sleep
items.review_text:
We were very disappointed with our recent journey to Inverness.Staff were great. But you cannot sleep on this sleeper unless your high off the floor!

We booked the double bed for a once in a lifetime treat - costing £480 on the 19th July.

Lying on the bed it was tremendously loud, jolting and uncomfortable - impossible to sleep. So hardly a sleeper. You constantly hear the sound pf the wheels on the sleepers.This Spanish made coaches were not designed for harsh Victorian metal rails.
We were so tired the next day our  friend and family reunion was really ruined.

Really not a good service and we may not ever use it again which is quite sad.

items.title: As a regular sleeper traveller on the…
items.review_text:
As a regular sleeper traveller on the euston Inverness line I was greatly looking forward to my first trip on new trains
Bitterly disappointing
Staff disinterested (breakfast didn’t arrive and I am now told club car closed) 
Much more bumpy ride- the old suspension was better.
Light in en suite always on and shines through door
Lights on control panels always on
This is not progress 
I have one more trip pre booked and then that’s me for flying

items.title: Onboard Host!!!!
items.review_text: Appalling Service once onboard avoid at all costs. Travelled from London to Glasgow with the sheer delight of host Kym, rude, obnoxious and more interested in her iPad watching a film (later discovered when I entered the club car and she had ear phones in) she certainly isn't an asset to the sleeper and I will not travel again.

items.title: As a Scot I used to take this train…
items.review_text: As a Scot I used to take this train fairly often, the new service is definitely not worth the money though. I’d strongly suggest getting a day train or flying instead. If you just want to do a sleeper train in the UK try the night riveria service from Paddington, it’s far superior for the price.

items.title: Fabulous treat, excellent service.
items.review_text: Recently travelled up overnight from London to Glasgow, and enjoyed the experience immensely. Started off in a comfortable lounge @ Euston with complementary snacks and soft drinks, the guided onto train, by a fabulous ( and very smart ) Steward called Stephen. He was most helpful with visiting advice, but maintained dignity and decorum at all times. The space was compact, and the bathroom a little primitive, but that surely is to be expected. Lying on beautiful crisp sheets, staring at the landscape going by, while tea and breakfast is brought to the door is an exceptional treat.

items.title: Horrible experiences from staff. Broken aircon, broken toe, panicked passengers.
items.review_text:
Horrible experiences from staff. Rude, dismissive, ignored, lied about communication. Broken aircon, my nauseous autistic son was told he should just try and get some rest, no room with arcon until hours later and only due to me chasing up, so leaving my upset, nauseous, knackered son. New room no ensuite which was needed for y autistic son. Chasing for a room was not what I should have had to do during that time. Arrived 45mins early, before breakfast, then they try to rush you off by saying they're closing the doors and getting ready to depart at no point saying that you have until 7.30am to disembark. People rushing off train, dazed and confused. I broke my toe rushing to get down the ladder after one of these announcements. Vegan breakfast was not vegan. 
If you're looking for a once in a lifetime treat and introduction to the magic of sleeper trains, or even just a 'good enough' experience then look elsewhere.

items.title: Disappointed
items.review_text:
I travelled  on the old sleeper between  Inverness  and Euston  regularly over the last 10 years and  
was eager to try the new service.
What a disappointment. 
No 1 beds are more uncomfortable 
2 cabin noise is more pronounced 
3 no hot water(you could wash and shave with piping hot supply  previously)
4 toilets use the unhygienic  dry suction method , and a backwards step from the old water based ones.
5 the double hinged toilet doors are really  difficult to operate ,especially for older people.
In short there absolutely  no improvement overall. 
Travelling on business you are not so focused  on other issues(such as food or refreshments) 
Your main concern is to have a decent sleep and arrive refreshed for the day ahead 
I'm  afraid the new sleeper falls short in all areas

items.title: The Caledonian Sleeper: a survivor’s tale.
items.review_text: The Caledonian Sleeper ‘seated coach’ experience: as told by a survivor. Glasgow-bound, our holiday cheer began to fade as we boarded our train to find one toilet out of order and our second toilet blocked. Leaving Euston, we failed to shake the bright lights of the city as the staff were unable to dim any of the main carriage lights for the duration. Despite the summer evening chugging by outside - inside the coach was Baltic thanks to the overachieving air conditioning. After several brave passengers complained, their frosty breath still hanging in the air, we were each given blankets - one hour before our scheduled arrival in Glasgow. As fortune would have it, we were blessed extra blanket time because the train arrived late. In Edinburgh.

items.title: Use alternative. Customer service helpful, but ice cold and brightly lit seat carriage ;(
items.review_text: For the amount of money we paid for a seat, we should have at least had an experience similar to sleeping in an airplane seat. The carriage was brightly lit throughout the night, the toilet had an announcement ‘voice’ that you could hear from the carriage and worst of all… the air conditioning was turned up extremely high making it impossible to sleep or even think of anything else but the cold. I regret not having booked the fast day train and just paid for an overnight hotel. Will never book this service again.

items.title: My wife and I travelled London to…
items.review_text: My wife and I travelled London to Aberdeen in a Classic cabin on 11/11/19. The new coaches were poor. Top bunk ladder too vertical and rungs to narrow to climb in bare feet! Matresses offered no support and were very uncomfortable. Cabin temp too hot, no airconditioning. Constant loud wind noise from an air vent and a very rough ride at all times. Would not use again. The day train is much more comfortable.

items.title: stranded mums needing to get home
items.review_text:
Myself and my friend were stranded in London yesterday due to our flights being cancelled, we have two small boys who are 4 who we had to be home asap to look after them.
The staff on the Caledonian sleeper were outstanding !! Wilson who had to deal with two erratic women we were both in tears just trying to get home and the let us on the train and gave us a cabin so we could rest. They literally saved us from being stuck in London away from our sons, I literally can’t thank the staff enough they were amazing.
Customer service is outstanding, we will never forget the kindness they showed and how loverly everyone was – thank you thank you thank you !!!!!

items.title: So called Caladonian Sleeper
items.review_text:
I booked an upgraded cabin which includes a toilet and shower. The toilet is enclosed within a box and the shower/toilet cubicle is so small the only way in which a shower can be effectively taken is by sitting on the toilet box. The cabins are very small and the bunk beds uncomfortable at best. There is no room for a suitcase other than a small area infront of the bunk beds.

Currently breakfast consists of a bacon roll or pot of porridge, a cereal bar, small bottle of orange or apple juice, a paper cup of hot water and a tea bag or nescafe stick  delivered to the cabins, in our case 10 minutes before the train arrived at Glasgow. 

I will not be using this service again.

items.title: Too cold and uncomfortable
items.review_text:
The seats were very hard and they don't recline so there's not much sleep happening in the Sleeper. 
Also, there's no air con so we were freezing to and from our trip London-Glasgow.
The breakfast was horrendous and very expensive for what you get.
Wouldn't put myself through that again.

items.title: Terrible experience
items.review_text: Arrived last Thursday evening only to find the fully booked  train cancelled, we had received no information prior to our arrival. Sat on cold platform for over an hour waiting for accommodation, as were allowed to sleep on train overnight. Told that we had to find alternative way to get to London and that was not their responsibility. Altogether lost a whole day of our weekend break, had to get two further trains, missed our connection and incurred a lot of further expense.

items.title: Had to book and travel to another…
items.review_text: Had to book and travel to another station as train from my local station was fully booked - so extra train costs. Turns out the train does not actually run from my local station anyway at the moment and they funnel customers to Edinburgh. The connecting journey was a nightmare and thought I'd miss the sleeper so seriously stressed. Service was so-so but the fixed ladder at the bed was a nightmare and the bathroom door was difficult to close properly. Breakfasts and lounges are poorly stocked but at least we arrived on time. Unfortunately, I thought it would be a better experience and purchased a flexipass... won't be doing that again.

items.title: Absolutely awful  and embarrassing company
items.review_text:
Absolutely awful company
Took ill a few hours before travelling and was told their flexible ticket cancellation policy was a day and a half before journey so wouldn’t be able to cancel or change dates so lost the best part of £550 
So looks like you need be clairvoyant to travel on this train and now they have blocked me and deleted all my comments on their social media sites not exactly a very professional way to run a company!!!

items.title: Having missed a flight from Gatwick
items.review_text: Having missed a flight from Gatwick, I booked a ticket to Inverness on the Caledonian Sleeper, with the expectation of reclining sleeper seating. The seats were comfy enough upright, but only reclined about 2 degrees from upright, and it was impossible to sleep without one's head nodding forward, which isn't comfortable at all. It's advertised as a sleeper seat, but no way would you describe it as such after using it. Very false advertising, and a rip off price of nearly £400 for two. Extremely dissappointing experience, and never again. Even the conductor agreed with me, saying though, don't worry, when you're tired enough you'll nod off, most people do!

items.title: Our first time on this service
items.review_text:
Our first time on this service, London to Inverness and return. The rolling stock is quite new and in decent condition. Yes the twin bed room is very compact. And getting into the top bunk is not that easy ( at my age!) getting down is even worse.
We found the mattresses quite comfy , but at the end of the day, You are in a train , going crickety clack all night long, and jostling over points on the track. 
We found the staff in London based and Scottish based teams very helpful and efficient. Food surprisingly good. But there were very few passengers on our journeys.
All in all, a reasonable experience. You just need realistic expectations of how much sleep you will get.

items.title: I traveled from Preston up to Scottish…
items.review_text: I traveled from Preston up to Scottish highlands and was quite nervous about travelling in the early hours on my own. The lady that helped me to my room was excellent, not only did she put me at ease but gave me a wake up call with a cup of tea and came back 5 mins before my stop to make sure I didn’t miss it. 100% would use this service again.

items.title: Don't do it, just fly. I was seriously injured and staff were not equipped to help.
items.review_text:
I received first and second degree burns from a spilled hot drink delivered for breakfast.  It wasn't coffee as ordered, but scalding hot water.  It was an avoidable accident that should never have happened with proper staff training.

There was no first aider on board and the staff panicked rather than helped.  They seemed more concerned about taking photographs of the injury for the accident book (which I do not imagine is a requirement and given that they seemed to use their own mobile devices, a breach of GDPR).  

They seem more focused on selling a romanticised version of the service than they do on actually delivering a good service.

I will never use again.

items.title: Don't waste your money.
items.review_text: Received a text message whilst travelling to Euston, just a couple of hours before departure, telling me there was no food in the Club Car due to staff shortages. A bit more notice would've been appreciated. Nice to have access to the first class lounge when I got to Euston; however, that's where the 'glamour' finished. Despite ear plugs, the journey was very noisy and the train rattles your bones. Felt like old stock being used...dreadful. Had about 3 hours sleep and arrived feeling dreadful. Got a BA flight back. Not worth the huge price and will not bother again.

items.title: Train was cancelled with only a few…
items.review_text:
Train was cancelled with only a few hours notice. This meant we had to book last minute flights which cost us an extra £100.

When your train is booked, they say your ticket is valid on some other trains, but those trains cannot be booked in advance. You literally have to simply hope there is room on a train (they were almost all sold out) for you to use your ticket on. Very disappointed with this experience, just book flights ahead of time at a reasonable price and avoid the sleeper train fiasco!

items.title: I was going to travel from London to…
items.review_text: I was going to travel from London to Glasgow, when booking I have been told all sorts of different information, prices change on an hourly basis £50 each way to £220 each way, not guaranteed a room even though that's exactly what you book. I'm not able to go now and have been reduced to tears over this awful company.

items.title: Poor, expensive service - last-minute cancellations
items.review_text:
Being chucked out of the lounge at ten o'clock and then being told we need to wait an hour and a half in the freezing cold, then get a train to Motherwell to meet the train it's just poor. It was also obvious the staff knew this was going to happen but decided to wait to tell us.

The lounge itself comes across as more of an inconvenience to the staff, and you are not getting a good service.

Save your money, don't use this service.
Poor service and definitely not worth it.

items.title: Unreliable service, staff lack knowledge
items.review_text:
A great service when you're onboard but any time before that is unreliable.

My first trip in September got diverted to Edinburgh instead of Glasgow as planned which wasn't ideal if you're hoping to get an early start on the West Highland Way.

More recently, in the 25th Oct they cancelled a return journey from Fort William due to a planned strike from ScotRail during COP26. They kept the outbound journey running, but this obviously had to be cancelled due to no return being available. We cancelled on the 26th Oct but Caledonian Sleeper failed to tell us the strike had been cancelled that same day, so they ruined our holiday for no reason.

items.title: Caledonian Sleeper
items.review_text:
I try to get up to Scotland maybe once a month as it's home and I was hoping to take my dog north with me this weekend but booked without checking that they'd charge £94 for her to travel with me. 

Due to this, and the fact that I have to work this weekend, I will be in London and had to seek a refund: the process was fast and sleek and the refund processed in short order.

I'll be travelling on the Caledonian Sleeper again soon!

items.title: customer service terrible
items.review_text: Havant even managed to get on the train and I'm already annoyed. Booking process is a joke. They said they will give me a discount due to the booking process being broken. But they never honoured it. Lots of backwards and forwards and frankly shockingly difficult. The price is insane and its a fraction to just use the fast train by day or even less to fly. I wanted the experience but the price was hard to swallow and now there is no experience as I'm so annoyed with the terrible customer service

items.title: Seats very uncomfortable
items.review_text: Seats very uncomfortable, hard and doesnt support your legs. Armrests cut your circulation. Lights are on full. I managed about 3 hours broken sleep, now im awake at 4.45 am. Seat does slide back but not much. Ticket London to Glasgow was £50, cheapish. Would I do this again? Never !

items.title: Woke up a 1 am in morning to move my…
items.review_text: Woke up a 1 am in morning to move my bike to a different carriage...Had to sit in dining carriage for a long time while I was waiting for this...All the time the unprofessional staff were being very loud and messing about on their phones. Lovely.!!.Absolutely fuming 😤

items.title: Very very disappointing
items.review_text: Very very disappointing. I booked a seat from Inverness to London at £75 (over £200 for a bed was not an affordable option). The seats are really hard and uncomfortable and do not recline as expected. I am currently sitting inside the freezing carriage with another 2 hours of ice cold temperatures before I make it to London. I ordinarily wouldn’t order food or tea before arrival, but wanted something to try and warm myself up - apparently you need to order anything the night before. Needless to say, I doubt I’d ever choose this method of travel again - if you can get a flight, that would be my recommendation.

items.title: Happy Caledonian Sleeper Customer
items.review_text:
Just got back from trying out the new Caledonian sleeper from Euston to Inverness and really liked it, the train was on time leaving and it got into Inverness 45 mins early !
The staff were friendly but I got the vibe that they were not happy with the  stock. 
The ride was as expected, a mild joggling and rocking but it's a moving train not a hotel. I took my noise cancelling earphones which was a good move as there was a noticeable track howl most of the way up which was significantly reduced with my earphones. I found £4.50 for a coke can sized beer expensive but you are a captive market. 
The cabin was the usual size but as expected, the bed was nice and comfy and clean as was the interior of the train. 
I would definitely use it again.

items.title: First time in new coaches
items.review_text: First time in new coaches!  High expectations given their marketing.  Used to use the old service quite a bit.  En-suite club room booked.  Extremely disappointed.  Design of rooms is poor; the en-suite is a joke.  No hot water.  Pathetic water flow.  But, the worst thing is that they seem to have forgotten the train suspension - every thing felt.  Would not use again - I’ll fly.  Serco have royally screwed up the new trains!

items.title: Nancy and Julie, the best hostesses any company could have
items.review_text:
I was injured in a fall at Euston before boarding the sleeper, I went to the dining car to ask for ice and I have never before had such kind and thoughtful service, ice was packed around my leg and I was encouraged to stay till the pain eased, I then went back to my cabin, one of the two hostess followed me, bandaged up my leg and made sure I was comfortable. The next morning I got an intercom call to check I was alright and a colleague of the two women came to help me down the step.

Julie and Nancy, dining car hostesses on the Caledonian sleeper on November 6 are the best ambassadors the company could have, customer care like that makes up for a lot of the teething troubles of the service.

My ankle was broken.

Helen November 7 2019

items.title: arrive in Scotland refreshed
items.review_text:
This is a great way to get to Scotland but you have to be pretty mobile for the single bunk rooms. They are very narrow and best only used to actually sleep as you can't sit up in the top bunk. 
Nice linen and the granola yoghurt breakfast was good.
In the morning you can lie in bed and watch the scenery go by.
We were woken at 4 am to move our bikes to another carriage. This is a terrible system and i would have given fewer stars except for the helpfulness of our host Gillian who made up for it.

items.title: I regularly travel on the Caledonian…
items.review_text:
I regularly travel on the Caledonian Sleeper, but I usually travel from Inverness. This was to Edinburgh and the timings are very different.
The staff were great, very helpful. I was very disappointed not to get porridge. Other than that- just lovely.

items.title: Had a pleasant experience travelling to Scotland
items.review_text: Had a pleasant experience with the booking, travel and breakfast served on the train. We booked for Glasgow return and post onward journey had change of plans and had to catch this train from Edinburgh, so called the customer care 2days in advance and they changed the ticket from Glasgow to Edinburgh without any issue as there was availability there. Overall a positive experience start to end.

items.title: I've always had a good experience…
items.review_text: I've always had a good experience travelling on the overnight trains. I know what to expect, and it's so good to wake up at the other end of the UK. I've come on to TrustPilot to review them as I had a problem with my travel plans and needed to make a change, and the man at the end of the phone this afternoon was so helpful in letting me change plans for Friday night, so the journey could start in Inverness not Edinburgh. I really appreciated having a listening ear to the difficulties that had come up, and the discretionary treatment was very welcome.

items.title: Don't waste your money when there are better alternatives
items.review_text:
Booked a club room with a shower and toilet, I was told there was a fault with the room and moved rooms, of which this room also had a fault (the engineer had taken off the light fitting in the toilet/shower room) and was told I couldn't use the shower or toilet in the room. I was only given a 33% refund when the difference in price between a room with and without a toilet and shower is 50% (I was told by staff on the train I would be receiving a 50% refund); meaning I had to spend nearly 2 days without showering. I was also disturbed several times by the staff taking pictures of the fault. Just to add the breakfast is awful.
Don't waste your money fly and stay in a hotel for the night, its a lot quicker and costs a similar price.

items.title: Jesus where do I start
items.review_text: Jesus where do I start. If you are above 65kg in weight or over 5’6”  then do not book. Room is smaller than a prison cell and inhumane. Guarantee the worst nights sleep of your life. Room smells constantly of diesel and poo. Staff rude and miserable. Breakfast I was given a whole half slice of bacon. They kick you out of lounge as soon as you’ve eaten. Honestly the worst experience I’ve ever had travelling. Would have had a better night sleep on a toilet floor. Paper cups for your hot drinks. Dogs on the train and in the rooms. Cost £600 for 2 of us. Bunk beds were 2’6”. My back is killing me. Risk of serious injury in the room and getting in and off the top bunk. I’m surprised they haven’t been sued yet. It’s just interesting they do not respond to complaints on here. Probably should given 80% of your customers hated the experience

items.title: Disappointed with the room layout.
items.review_text: Claustrophobic. Tiny cabin, tiny window, no table or shelving at all. The room feels like a basement storage cell or a cargo compartment. Disappointment.

items.title: It really grieves us to give this poor…
items.review_text: It really grieves us to give this poor review. We have travelled north to our second home near Inverness and back to London many times on the old Sleeper over the last decade so we were excited to try the new carriages. It was a huge disappointment. Despite earlier feedback, the old fashion officious check in system remains unchanged. The new club class cabin  'room' looks good but the design has not retained sensible things like handles on the wall to get down from the top bunk.  The night lights are very bright and cannot be dimmed.  The top bunk has an uncomfortable edge.  The loo causes the toilet roll to become damp during the night. Delight at having a shower was dashed as the water remained cold despite running for 10 minutes.  Even with Covid, we will probably fly next time, which is really sad as we much prefer train travel. These things could and should have been resolved.

items.title: Excellent Service
items.review_text:
Just travelled up and down to Scotland on the sleeper and the staff and service has been brilliant. You get woken up when you want (for me after the train has arrived so you get as much sleep as possible) the beds are comfortable and there is plenty of room for luggage on board.

You don't sleep as well as in a proper bed, but that is to be expected, on the other hand you arrive at your destination early in the morning meaning you get the better part of two extra days in Scotland more than you'd get by driving up, getting the daytime train or flying.

items.title: A dreadful experience 4 hours late
items.review_text: A dreadful experience we left Euston at 2100 hrs in the seated carriage bound for Inverness traveled 5 miles then returned to Euston no tickets checked didn't see the train manager no explanation We left again at well after midnight not a peep out of any train staff I pressed the button to ask the question why i was told by catering staff he would pass the message on . Turning my phone back on at 2am I received an explanation and was told the train manager would make an announcement in the morning it's now 14 hours after boarding still not seen a train manager or heard any announcements but seen many leave the train.its time to take the DAY TRAIN LNER

items.title: Love the train, hate the misinformation
items.review_text:
I've never experienced the old sleeper train, but I was thrilled with this one. 
Booking was easy, and there was a lot of information on COVID related changes, inc change in timetable. 
We got to Euston early as we didn't want to risk missing this (pricey) experience. There was no Caledonian staff present, and their stand was abandoned. Our altered timetable wasn't reflected on the departure board, and National Rail staff had no info on any changes. Luckily, cleaners and assistance crew knew more than info desk staff, and we found out where the train was and where to find the crew. There was no change to timetable despite online notice. 
On the train, I found the cabin cosy, bottom bunk comfortable, and the sink sufficient. My partner did not enjoy the top bunk as he found it to be somewhat uncomfortable. The train ride was nice too, but I agree with reviews saying that the night light was too strong and we ended up using information cards to cover lights. I would like to use it again but not for that price.

items.title: SHOCKING CUSTOMER SERVICE
items.review_text:
This review is based totally on customer service rather than travel.
I had booked online a flexible London to Glasgow return club room for £360 (£180 each way) Impeding strike action by Caledonian sleeper staff made me alter my plans to catch the last sleeper return journey before the strike began. I called customer service to bring my flexible return journey forward a day, to be told that they couldn't do this, and that I would have to cancel and rebook the entire journey.
The outward journey had jumped in price from £180 to £290 whilst the return on the earlier date was now £210..So instead of £360 they were going to charge £500...When I pointed that I was changing because of THEM, I was told that's just the way the system works...
NO .THEY DID NOT GET £500
SHOCKING, SHOCKING, SHOCKING.

items.title: Seats don't recline
items.review_text: Seats don't recline. How can a sleeper service not have seats you can sleep in. Absolute torture . I actually can't belive they get away with this and ordered a train you can't physically sleep on

items.title: A terrible and depressing experience.
items.review_text:
Have you ever wondered what a sardine feels like inside a tin can? Well, now you can find out! 

I was stupidly drawn into the experience that they are selling on their website, upon arrival to the train, instead of getting a feel of glitz and glamour, I felt like a prisoner, In a cell so small it hardly contained enough oxygen to keep a human being alive, let's try opening a window to get some air, you can't!

On a serious note, this is the personification of late stage capitalism, where human beings are being herded in conditions worse than livestock travel for the pursuit of a companies bottom line, it's the most dehumanising experience I've witnessed in a developed nation. 

In short, no water to drink, no air to breathe, and no room to move. For your own sake, I hope you to avoid this company for your entire lives.

items.title: Railcard users beware
items.review_text: Railcard users beware, Caledonian Sleeper have decided to no longer honour senior and other discount rail cards when you book their twin berth cabins. They claim it is because of the new trains - actually it seems to just be a convenient revision to their booking rules to extract more money from their passengers. The website gives the impression that the discount has been applied when booking - but it hasn't. Very disappointing behaviour.

items.title: Caledonian sleeper CANCELLED at the last minute
items.review_text:
Caledonian sleeper from Inverness to Euston on Dec 27th CANCELLED AT THE LAST MINUTE due to frozen pipes.
News flash: it’s cold in winter and it’s very cold in winter in Scotland. Surely a competent service provider would have a process to make sure pipes don’t freeze on a train in winter. Cancelled literally last minute and stuck with two young children in Scotland and totally messed up our plans.
Got a phone call and they’ve put us on an early morning train but now we have to sit for nearly 8 hours on busy trains with two upset and extremely bored children. Given they have a reciprocal relationship with the other rail services so they don’t have to pay for our tickets I don’t think they are punished enough for this disgrace of a service. 
I hope this puts people off going with Caledonian sleeper as you won’t want to spend your last day in Scotland fretting whether you will need to stay another night as the train can literally be cancelled up until the last minute. Shoddy and disgustingly awful level of service

items.title: Very helpful train manager
items.review_text: Of course it can be hard to get a good night sleep on a moving train, but the train manager was really pragmatic and made my journey a lot easier when he really didn't need to.  It made it a great experience for me.

items.title: Failed on so many levels to provide…
items.review_text:
Failed on so many levels to provide what was required.
-No waiting lounge at Euston - No dedicated staff at Euston.
-Reserved seat cards in carriage were all misplaced.
-Opposing seats left no personal space for either occupant - (if I didn't have sciatic before I now have experienced it).
-Only visited by a ticket collector upon departure and a host prior to arrival.
-No information volunteered about service.
-No refreshments or beverage service offered.
-Carriage was cool and then later far too hot - opened carriage windows and internal doors to let heat escape. (This was until train split at Edinburgh when normal temp resumed).
-Carriage toilet blocked by half way through journey (both became blocked during second half).
-No power points fitted at seating
-Partition table no more than a triangular cup stand.

I priced a one-way berth 2 days before travel and when booking the next day there were none available but the price paid remained the same £176. I asked upon boarding if a cabin was available and was told yes but for an additional £140 - £316 no thanks!

Caveat - arrived safe and on time. The staff I did speak with were as pleasant and as helpful as they were able.

items.title: Falls well short of expectations set by the marketing - VERY POOR!
items.review_text:
Poor experience from start to finish. The most impressive thing is the marketing!... the experience falls well short of this.

Forget a relaxing night’s sleep to Scotland, you feel every rivet of the track as you’re jolted around like a jelly on a vibrating plate.

Old, tired train carriages are in need of significant refurbishment, they completely lack style and practicality. Rooms and dining car lack cleanliness. In-room washing facilities are not adequate, partly due to lack of a mixer-tap and scalding hot water. Toilets are basic. 

Food, whilst well presented, is very poor – microwaved meals, seriously?! With the kitchen door left open, viewing the food preparation is not very appetising. 

Staff were fine, but better training is required to ensure they deliver the best possible customer experience – it currently lacks refinement or a personal touch.

items.title: Not great.
items.review_text: Service was on time however there was no catering. Breakfast was a warm orange juice in a plastic bottle and a cereal bar. At least they sent a text about three hours before departure to let me know about it. They said it was due to these difficult times. That excuse from rail companies is getting a bit thin. The cabins above the wheels are quite noisy. Would use them again but only if I had to.

items.title: Broken Down Train, Tired and Hungry.
items.review_text:
We definitely received the 'Hotel Experience'...The 'Fawlty Towers Hotel' Experience.

We arrived at Glasgow Central for the 2340 to Euston with plenty of time to spare, being my first time on the sleeper I didn't know what the protocol was. There were no Caledonian Staff around to help, and no obvious instructions on our e-ticket. In the end we asked a member of Network Rail staff where the sleeper is and the directed us to the train. However, still no Caledonian Sleeper Staff to be seen! After getting cold on the platform were finally allowed on the train. Skip forward to 0600am. The train had broken down and was sitting just outside Preston (we should have been near London by now). The staff didn't have clear information for us, and there was no breakfast being served, not even a cup of tea! It was carnage. We ended up getting off at Wigan where we continued our journey by Avanti to London arriving into Euston 3.5 hours late, tired and hungry.

items.title: Customer Care.... none
items.review_text: booked to travel on this service, a return ticket (£550), flexible ticket but that doesn't mean anything as you can only cancel not ammend ticket according to their terms and conditions no later than lunchtime the day before you travel. So in this instance my partner fell ill, could not physical move from the illness and there response to this was ,"well it should have been canceled yesterday by lunchtime ". So we were supposed to be psychic and know more than 36 hours before travel that we could not travel. Flexible ticket means nothing. Absolutely no attempt made to help us other than contact your travel insurance. We travel 5 to 6 times a year with them and to be honest be hard pushed to use them again. Once they have your money they really don't care. Perhaps they would of preferred if I should of just carried my partner on to the train and then half way thru the journey pulled the emergency stop and request an ambulance. I've had better service from Ryanair.

items.title: A bit like trying to sleep on a crash…
items.review_text:
A bit like trying to sleep on a crash mat in the back of a van I would imagine. 
Mattress was very thin and uncomfortable. 
The train is far from smooth so you get woken up many times during the night. We got about 4 hours sleep.
The restaurant had 75% of the menu unavailable. 
Our carriage was unable to provide tea or coffee in the morning because the boiler was broken.
All this for £440. Never again!

items.title: Disappointed by the "revamped" seating experience
items.review_text:
Disappointed by the revamped trains. 

I travelled on the sleeper service a few times while studying in Edinburgh a number of years ago. I often used the seated class, but had occasionally got a cabin where the price was reasonable. 

However, on my most recent return journey, I was disappointed in the experience. The seated prices seem to have inflated significantly however were advertised as being suited to sleep. Unfortunately, the carriage remained brightly light, there were lots of noises (such as the toilet door announcing it was locking, etc) and there wasn't much legroom to get comfortable. There was a strong sense of being second-class passengers for sitting in seating - access to the food cart seemed to be discouraged for example.  The seats did benefit from a charger and reading light. The customer service (online chat) was mainly effective - although a delay repay refund did require some chasing to come through. 

Will probably just fly next time as it will be cheaper and a better experience.

items.title: Ok but not great
items.review_text: Decent service if you want to wake up in the centre of London.  Do not expect much privacy though, the staff knock on your door and enter without your permission about 2 seconds later!

items.title: PO0R QUALITY CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE FROM A PREMIUM SERVICE
items.review_text:
What a lovely idea - waking up in the Highlands of Scotland (London to Fort William) and worth spending over £700 for a return ticket.  
But expensive does not equal total quality in this case.
The berth is small but perfectly put together (single Club cabin with en suite) and the sleeping experience is never going to be gentle rocking on the tracks and sighing of passing scenery.  It is noisy and jerky -but that's just the nature of a sleeper train.
It is the customer experience that is flawed. Needs a lot of work. 
Once you leave the berth and venture for an overpriced drink or bite in the dining car things go badly wrong.  The car is always full and there is not enough staff. On our last trip the wait staff (singular) were mainly unavailable but when they did have time to give some attention – wow, they were abrupt and unfriendly - verging on rude. Curt and short - as if customers were a massive inconvenience! 
Quite an uncomfortable experience. And we were keen to leave. Even that is hard. 
Tech is terrible – takes ages for the (same single member of ) staff  to input the details of orders when it comes to paying and then you have to wait on ‘being in a platform’ (!) to get signal for the payment system to fire up.  
Would never use the dining car again. Go straight to bed and eat the complimentary chocolate in the berth.  
Would also think twice about taking the sleeper train based on that experience.

items.title: Poor but with potential
items.review_text:
16th January service from Euston to Edinburgh. As avid sleeper train followers we were very excited and looking forward to the service. 

Trains are beautiful, lounge car is very stylish and Club cabins adequate.  Limited storage, making cabin difficult to orientate with 2 people.  Bed and bedding very good.

Food is excellent and very good value for money. 

HOWEVER, organisation, reliability and response to issues are appalling.  Our train was running 3 hours late but we had no communication.  People in classic cabins had no options for food.  The train stopped and started and chugged along so that no one could really sleep.  But insult to injury they announced 3 hours after the train should have arrived in Edinburgh that they were not going to bother splitting the train and all passengers would have to go to Glasgow.

All passengers were thrown off the train in Glasgow Central with no information or directions and expected to find their way to Glasgow Queen St station and onto Edinburgh.  Many older and foreign passengers had luggage or mobility problems and no help was offered. We eventually arrived in Edinburgh 5 hours late..

items.title: I understand that the cancellation was…
items.review_text:
I understand that the cancellation was inevitable due to apparent ''extreme weather'' (I'd heard nothing about it but that's beside the point) but what my main problem was that it was impossible to find out what would happen with my no longer useable day tickets until 6:30 the following morning ! 

I appreciate the fact that measures were taken to avoid passengers scrambling for the few hotels in zone 1 by the original train being used as a static hotel inside Euston

Edit: When I managed to get through to the guest service centre I think it's called , staff dealt with the problem relatively quickly and my "delay repay" arrived the following day!

items.title: Expensive, uncomfortable cold.
items.review_text:
Seats are maybe little bit more comfy then usual train, but hard. All night much more light when any other train. Why? Aircon loudly blowing cold air, closer to morning more colder. Every body freezing. Why?
Coffee probably worst i ever try.
Stuff is not bad, but not much in their hands.
2 hours delay on the way to Edinburgh. How?
Tikes i not cheap.

items.title: The customer service team very good.
items.review_text: The customer service team were very nice and prompt with dealing with a question. They wrote me a personal email within 24 hours which was great. Thanks

items.title: Det var den dårligste oplevelse med…
items.review_text: Det var den dårligste oplevelse med toget 7000.kr fra London til fort William, så forventer man da lidt service.  Det skulle være 1 klasse, men aircondition virkede ikke i 30 graders varme, bad om de ville se på det, der kom aldrig nogen. Jeg lider af en sygdom, hvor varme lammer min krop det forklarede min mand personalet  ombord de var ligeglade under al kritik. Morgenmaden vi fik var en tør bolle, kaffe og en varm juice var alt hvad vi fik. Vi kunne udfylde en seddel over hvad vi kunne tænke os, men 70% var streget ud. Vi havde kørestol og 2 kufferter og en rygsæk med, vognen det skulle være i blev frakoblet kl 4 om morgenen i Aberdeen (håbløst) Vi appellerede til togpersonalet om de ikke kunne finde et sted til kørestolen, de sagde klag til manageren!!!!Der manglede et lagen man kunne tage over sig, men lå med håndklæde istedet for. Fik kortvarigt klaustrofobi af at være i et lille varmt rum med al den bagage. Håber aldrig vi oplever dette igen :-( Personalet ombord var ligeglade og gad ikke passagerne tydeligt at mærke, talte med andre der var utilfredse. Den eneste ros er tjeneren i spisevognen, vi fortalte ham om vores problem jeg får jeg fat i en, og vupti kom kørestolen ind i et teknikrum til næste morgen.

items.title: Kindness
items.review_text:
Had an issue with the person sitting next to me who objected in particularly colourful language to being asked to swap to his actual seat.

Reported it to the catering person who got the train manager who very kindly arranged for me to have a cabin. I was travelling up for a funeral so the extra rest and kindness was much appreciated

items.title: Don’t use the Caledonian Sleeper! Used the sleeper service on Friday 3rd…
items.review_text:
Used the sleeper service on Friday 3rd December, joining train at Glasgow travelling to London.
Advertised use of exclusive lounge at Glasgow Central.
Lounge was closed.
2 hours before departure advised that no hot food would be served in Lounge on train.
Joined train, on platform we were asked what we would like for breakfast, bacon roll or oatmeal? No other choices available.
Breakfast delivered to cabin next day, our ‘coffee’ consisted of 2 cups of hot water with sachets of Nescafé, sugar and milk.
Sat in exclusive lounge of train, order taken by a young man who clearly didn’t want to be where he was. Do staff that work in the hospitality industry understand what hospitable means?
And so to bed, we expected the cabin to be small, expectations met.
I expected a comfortable mattress, even more important when the train is moving, mattress was terrible, possibly the worst in 40 years of extensive business and domestic travel.
Never again would I book this service, what’s advertised against what you receive is clearly misleading or has been written by someone who has never used the service or by a CEO’s vision of what he/she thinks they are offering.
I should really refer them to Trades Description.
Used BA and flew back, great service, no excuses and did exactly what they said they would.
Don’t use the sleeper, take a normal train or plane.

items.title: Staff were so friendly and welcoming
items.review_text: Staff were so friendly and welcoming. Beds were comfy. The train wasn’t the smoothest ride ever - but still overall a great experience and will be doing it again!

items.title: travelled on sleeper between Edinburgh…
items.review_text: travelled on sleeper between Edinburgh London on 20th December ret on 2nd jan 2020 first off due to a problem passengers left standing in cold weather for 30 mins some with children.surely as a good gesture passengers should have been told to wait in the lounge and someone would fetch them when ready.tirst trip on new sleeper what a let down unlike the old trains no room to store luggage which means one person has to sit on bunk while the other gets ready and then swap over.the rungs on the ladder are so narrow they hurt your feet.having travelled by sleeper over many years I have to say that these new compartments are far worse than the old ones at least you could sit upright on the top bunk on the old trains unlike the new ones where you have to sit like Quasimodo with your neck bent as the ceiling is low.the headroom on the bottom bunk is not much better as your head touches the top bunk when you sit on the bed.it seems that they have designed the new compartments for maximum discomfort and upped the price.we will be travelling first class from now on with mofe room more comfort and free food and drinks at half the cost of the sleeper.when joining at tne station people have to hang around on the platform with no proper organisation.

items.title: Terrible experience for a Club Class…
items.review_text:
Terrible experience for a Club Class passenger paying £400 for the journey from London Euston to Edinburgh.

Totally unhelpful staff and no lounge was provided even though this is advertised on their website. We had a fantastic time is Scotland, however the Caledonian Sleeper journey spoiled it for us never again!

items.title: I would give 0 stars if it was…
items.review_text:
I would give 0 stars if it was possible. Never have I ever experienced such rude, argumentative, and unaccommodating staff - on a customer service telephone line no less.

Horrendous service, they don't give two rats about you or your experience and what they advertise on the website is not what you get.

items.title: Left Euston at 0115.
items.review_text:
Took the sleeper to Euston, arrived one hour late.. No explanation. Seats were incredibly uncomfortable, lighting is left on, but got us there. Only positive.
Return journey 
Awful. Left Euston 4/12 hours late. Eventually at 01.15 seated passengers were given cabins.
One fellow traveller was heading to a relatives funeral. They were eventually taken to a taxi from Edinburgh , one and a half hours after sitting stationary on the platform, leaving only 2 hours to make this funeral in the Highlands. Despite the huge delays that were known before we had even left London. The company failed this passenger more than most. 
By then we had all had text messages informing us of automatic refund. 
Not much use in that travellers case. 
A shambles from start to finish, as we eventually arrived in Inverness at 1.30pm. Felt sorry for the staff. On the whole they are too good to have to work for this company. They appeared to have as little idea as us as to why a simple engine breakdown can lead to a 5 hour delay in reaching Inverness. 

If you confined spaces, you'll be fine. The cabins are poky, the beds short and the windows do not open.  Fly or use the daytime train service as I usually do. I came off that train feeling as if I had flown half way across the world.

items.title: Appalling Customer Service
items.review_text:
With regards the Gary from Caledonian Sleeper customer service. 

My wife and friend were due to travel from Inverness to London on the sleeper. The reason it was booked was due to the fact that my wife’s friend has terminal cancer, travelling back home to South Africa - this her last day in the UK and they wanted / needed comfort, space and a pleasant evening using the fasciitis of the train. 

They were then informed that the train was cancelled from Inverness to Edinburgh and they would need to travel by coach instead! You can imagine that having to travel with 3 large suitcases and two dogs on a coach is hardly the experience that was expected. 

When I called on their behalf, I was met with Gary, who seems to think that “everyone is on the same boat”, completely ignoring the fact that there is a terminally I’ll passenger travelling with two dogs and 3 suitcases, already on morphine to cope with pain. 

When I asked to speak with a manager, I was told that “She was up to her eyes in more important things” and she might call back. 

His attitude is genuinely one of the most disgusting I’ve ever heard in my life and I will be in constant contact with this company until they apologise properly for this disgraceful level of service and understanding. 

Horrible

items.title: Appalling, consistently
items.review_text: Appalling. Every time I travel there is an issue with my room. The staff on the train agreed with me that the whole operation is a shambles - their words. They blame the management and I can’t disagree. It could be an amazing service.... the train is lovely but their operation is a disaster.

items.title: No Improvement
items.review_text: Uncomfortable in ‘Classic’ rooms i.e. bunk beds. Top bunk very difficult to climb in/out of and can only lay in it. Ride very bouncy and noisy. Cabin VERY narrow with little room for clothes so had to place them in sink thereby removing that facility. However, all this is more to do with the restrictions on British train sizes than anything. On one leg we had cabin with interconnecting door which rattled the whole time. This connected to a very loud couple next door who felt it necessary to whoop and shout both before and after their bar visit. One could have complained to the steward but she was as loud as them, shouting in the corridor. Maybe as they board, the steward could remind them of sleeping passengers and ask them to refrain from shouting, banging doors etc. Passengers appear to be randomly allocated to rooms so you have people alighting at 0500 who may want to go to sleep early next to passengers alighting 0800 who may prefer to stay in the bar and be a little raucous on their return. I was fortunate to get this at a fraction of the advertised price; if I’d paid the advertised £500, I’d be SERIOUSLY miffed (but you do get a free coffee. Well, a cup of hot water and a sachet of instant coffee.) Avoid and catch a regular train. This really is a poor, service.

items.title: I didn’t know changing trains at 1am was part of the deal?
items.review_text: You purchase a sleeper train to sleep, but no you have to get off one train half way just past 1am, to walk over from one platform to another. And then wait in the cold for nearly 20 minutes while they open the next train. Appalling.

items.title: Caledonian sleeper experience
items.review_text: Made an advance booking from Crewe to Inverness on the sleeper, 118 for a cabin outbound, 49 seat only return. Train arrived on time at Crewe and new comfy cabin. Bed and Bedding were very comfortable. All very new and smart. Scottish breakfast was ready at the booked time. The Carriages ride very hard so you feel a lot of track vibration. Managed 5 hours sleep then sat in the seats for the journey after breakfast, which you are discouraged from doing, the idea is that you return to the cabin sit on the bed . Return trip seated is less comfy. The seats are wide but hard, would benefit from aircraft style softer seats with proper reclining. Also not much food option so take your own food and drink. Take a small pillow and ear muffs as well if you use this option - not everyone sleeps through the night, although generally the seated carriage was quite quiet. No sleep for me on the way back, too uncomfortable. Biggest problems were the loco broke down both ways. So 2 hour delay at Stirling on the way, 4 hour delay by Livingstone on the return. This spoiled the experience. The Carriages are new but the loco's are old, and need to be upgraded and more reliable. To be fair by the time I reached both destinations I'd received an e-mail refunding both trips in full, so paid nothing. I'd use the service again but on advanced ticket with Senior rail card. Full price for a cabin both ways without the advance ticket but with rail card is £165 each way so quicker and cheaper to fly from Birmingham to Inverness airport. I'm hoping that as the train is new, services will improve over time, and the loco failures where just unfortunate co-incidences to have a failure both ways.

items.title: This is the first time I have travelled…
items.review_text:
This is the first time I have travelled on the new sleeper in the seats. I am use to sleeping in aircraft seats (and just done an overnight in a long haul flight into Heathrow), however the seats are the worst seating I have been on for a very long time. The hard seat backs are  set rigid, curved back and tilted back very little. The bottom seat can be slide out a little and some seats have foot rest. The design is very uncomfortable to sit it. They seem to have learnt nothing in design of seating from the aircraft industry. Though they give you night shades something airlines seem to have cutback on, the lighting throughout the seater carriage always is always bright with strong lights  above windows. Aircraft dims their lights on long haul flights overnight, why cannot the Caledonian Sleeper? The only 2 positive things I can find to say about the new seated area is 1) there are now only 3 seats across, a single on one side and double on other and 2) the price for the seating is in line with that on the old sleeper (due to Government making it a condition of award of funding the Sleeper carriages).
Lastly:
1) With Covid airlines in who's planes air is issued near ceiling level and sucked out at floot level and mask wearing it enforced, so very much limiting the potential of spread of virus. In contrast the seated sleeper air is generally issued at seat level and may be vented at ceiling vent. Few people were wearing masks.
2) Turning to the sleeper bunk bed service. This new service fails to meet the needs of regular Aberdeen London traveller a) its twice as expensive as the old sleeper and uneconomic to alternatives, eg daytime trains or flights. and b) it is usually found be be fully booked if only booking a few days ahead.

items.title: Absolute dissapointment
items.review_text:
In July, a weekend golfing at St Andrews all lined up, with a overnight cabin from London the night before - As this was a special occasion- happilly paid £350 for a cabin thinking a few beers during the night and arrive fresh as a daisy with a full breakfast (as advertised on their website).
